text: Ian Richard Kyle Paisley, Baron Bannside (6 April 1926 - 12 September 2014) was a politician and church minister in Northern Ireland. He founded the Democratic Unionist Party (DUP) in 1971 and was its leader until May 2008. He was born in Armagh and grew up in Ballymena. He founded the Free Presbyterian Church of Ulster in 1951 and was a Member of Parliament (MP) for the constituency of North Antrim from 1970 to 2010. He was the First Minister of Northern Ireland from May 2007 to June 2008 at the head of an all-party government. He called himself the Reverend Doctor Ian Paisley. Paisley died in Belfast on 12 September 2014, aged 88. At the time of his death, Paisley suffered from cardiomyopathy. ==References== Category:1926 births Category:2014 deaths Category:Democratic Unionist Party MPs Category:Leaders of political parties in the United Kingdom Category:United Kingdom Life Peers Category:MEPs for the United Kingdom Category:Democratic Unionist Party members of the Northern Ireland Assembly Category:Presbyterian ministers Category:Members of the Privy Council of the United Kingdom Category:UK MPs 1970–1974 Category:UK MPs 1974 Category:UK MPs 1974–1979 Category:UK MPs 1979–1983 Category:UK MPs 1983–1987 Category:UK MPs 1987–1992 Category:UK MPs 1992–1997 Category:UK MPs 1997–2001 Category:UK MPs 2001–2005 Category:UK MPs 2005–2010 Category:First Ministers of Northern Ireland
title: Ian Paisley
